abstract: Shares of Bristol-Myers Squibb declined as much as 4 percent Monday after the Times of London reported over the weekend that its talks to merge with Sanofi Aventis, a deal that would form the world’s No. 2 drugmaker, had been called off. The newspaper said the discussions — reported late last month but never acknowledged by either side — faltered because of disagreements about price and the legal uncertainty surrounding Bristol Myers’ top-selling drug, Plavix. A UBS analyst called the report “surprising” and said in a research note that Bristol-Myers was probably still in play.
